Post-Match Reflections: The Heat organization has officially hit rock bottom, as they drop Saturday’s game to a tanking 7-25 Jazz squad at home by 36 points.
The Players morale is rock bottom.
Miami was already struggling to find a consistent identity all season, and Butler’s fiasco didn’t help that notion.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jazz had a 57-32 advantage in rebounds.
Brice Sensabaugh led the Jazz with 34 points off the bench.
Nikola Jovic and Duncan Robinson added 17 and 16 points, respectively, for the Heat.
Bam Adebayo had a quiet 4 points and 8 rebounds, with his only points coming from the free throw line.
Tyler Herro added 15 points on shaky 4 of 12 shooting.
The Heat played poorly from the three-point line, shooting 26% from 3-point range and 44% from the field.
